item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 13, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Starship Flight 5: Launch and booster catch [video] (1405 points | 870 comments)
2. Refurb weekend: the Symbolics MacIvory Lisp machine I have hated (23 points | 5 comments)
3. Making the Tibetan language a first-class citizen in the digital world (118 points | 53 comments)
4. The quiet art of attention (263 points | 94 comments)
5. Introducing Our New Name (28 points | 11 comments)
6. Show HN: Chain Traverser – Fast Ethereum graph explorer (32 points | 1 comment)
7. All asteroids in Solar System, visualized (25 points | 6 comments)
8. Diffusion for World Modeling (389 points | 183 comments)
9. A dictionary of single-letter variable names (41 points | 26 comments)
10. CRLF is obsolete and should be abolished (225 points | 120 comments)
11. A novel channel contention mechanism for improving wi-fi's reliability (66 points | 26 comments)
12. Common Lisp implementation of the Forth 2012 Standard (88 points | 52 comments)
13. Christopher Columbus may have been Spanish and Jewish, documentary says (29 points | 58 comments)
14. Lessons learned from profiling an algorithm in Rust (87 points | 11 comments)
15. Node.js, Pipes, and Disappearing Bytes (55 points | 28 comments)
16. Ward Christensen (of BBS and XMODEM fame) has died (182 points | 38 comments)
17. Restic: Backups done right (126 points | 61 comments)
18. Exploring Typst, a new typesetting system similar to LaTeX (510 points | 203 comments)
19. DARPA is funding reef structures that will be colonized by corals and bivalves (79 points | 20 comments)
20. Lessons from USAF Brutalism (5 points | discuss)
21. Large language models reduce public knowledge sharing on online Q&A platforms (309 points | 269 comments)
22. Even a single bacterial cell can sense the seasons changing (33 points | 12 comments)
23. Starship is Still Not Understood (2021) (35 points | 25 comments)
24. Interview with Yann LeCun on AI (56 points | 53 comments)
25. Show HN: I've added undo and redo to IsoCity (24 points | 9 comments)
26. Plop Boot Manager (6 points | 3 comments)
27. America's new millionaire class: Plumbers and HVAC entrepreneurs (94 points | 117 comments)
28. Can logic programming be liberated from predicates and backtracking? [pdf] (172 points | 61 comments)
29. Pepsi’s Soviet Navy (2021) (59 points | 17 comments)
30. 1 bug, $50k in bounties, a Zendesk backdoor (1461 points | 388 comments)
